get.description:
Skills can be queried by a substring of the name of the skill. This should be a string with one or more letters of the name of the skill requested.
For example, if we wanted to return skills like "Java" and "JavaScript", we may query with the substring "jav". A good use for this API would be a skill typeahead input.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Text query to filter returned skills

Skills can be queried by a substring of the name of the skill. This should be a string with one or more letters of the name of the skill requested.
For example, if we wanted to return skills like "Java" and "JavaScript", we may query with the substring "jav". A good use for this API would be a skill typeahead input.

get.description: This endpoint will return one of two possible responses, depending on if the slugged route's owner is a user or an organization. If the slugged route is owned by a user, the responses's owner relationship will have a user relationship and a nil organization relationship. If it's owned by an organization, it will have an organization relationship and a nil user relationship.

get.description: You can list all tasks or retrieve individual tasks for a single project.
get.operationId: List all of a project's tasks

get.description:
The `number` parameter in this endpoint is notably different from the usual `id`. Because the front-end Ember application loads a URL with the task's `number` (scoped to the project) for human readability, we don't actually know the `id`. The request is made with the `number` instead.
This allows us to have a logical numbering scheme for the project rather than extremely long `id`s.

description.description: Several lines describing the reasons for the goal

amount.description: The amount, in cents, for the goal.

current.description: Indicates whether this is the current donation goal. This is determined by whether 1) this is the highest goal and the total monthly raised is higher than that amount or 2) the total monthly raised is between the lower goal's amount (if it exists) and this goal's amount.

description.description: A short plain text description for the donation

amount.description: the amount of money in cents for the goal

detail.description: Details of what record was not found.

description.description: A short plain text description for the project

icon-large-url.description: A url pointing to a large icon for the project

icon-thumb-url.description: A url pointing to the project thumbnail

long-description-body.description: A html string containing the rendered `long-description-markdown`

long-description-markdown.description: Markdown formatted string containing the project long description

slug.description: corps' (string) - Case insensitive unique string identifier for the project

base64-icon-data.description: A base64 encoded string containing the project icon

business-name.description: The publicly visible name of the business

business-url.description: The publicly visible website of the business

charges-enabled.description: Whether or not the account can create live charges

details-submitted.description: Whether or not account details have been submitted yet. Standalone accounts cannot receive transfers before this is true.

display-name.description: The display name for this account. This is used on the Stripe dashboard to help differentiate between accounts.

managed.description: Whether or not the account is managed by your platform.

support-email.description: A publicly shareable email address that can be reached for support for this account

support-phone.description: The publicly visible support phone number for the business

support-url.description: A publicly shareable URL that can be reached for support for this account

transfers-enabled.description: Whether or not Stripe will send automatic transfers for this account. This is only false when Stripe is waiting for additional information from the account holder.

cvc-check.description: If a CVC was provided, results of the check.

created.description: A timestamp, indicating when the customer was created by Stripe.

delinquent.description: Whether or not the latest charge for the customers latest invoice has failed.

email.description: The email that the user used to create their Stripe Connect account.

id-from-stripe.description: The ID that Stripe assigned the customer.

amount.description: Describes the amount of a plan in cents.

created.description: A timestamp, indicating when the plan was created by Stripe

name.description: Name of the plan, to be displayed on invoices and in the web interface.

cancelled-at.description: If the subscription has been canceled, the date of that cancellation.

created.description: A timestamp, indicating when the plan was created by Stripe

current-period-end.description: End of the current period that the subscription has been invoiced for. At the end of this period, a new invoice will be created.

current-period-start.description: Start of the current period that the subscription has been invoiced for

customer-id-from-stripe.description: ID of the customer who owns the subscription

ended-at.description: If the subscription has ended (either because it was canceled or because the customer was switched to a subscription to a new plan), the date the subscription ended

start.description: Date the most recent update to this subscription started.
